other_tests.findings: Heterozygous mutation in the NKX2.5 gene (S265R) and a heterozygous mutation in the PAX8 promoter region (/H11002456C/H11022T).
Correct nuclear localization of both wild-type and mutant NKX2.5 proteins.
Mutant NKX2.5 binds to the NKE_2, DIO2, TG, and TPO promoter elements equally as the wild-type protein, but with 30-40% reduced transactivation of thyroglobulin and thyroid peroxidase promoters.
Mutant PAX8 promoter showed a significantly reduced transcriptional activation of a luciferase reporter gene compared to the wild-type promoter.
